docker_setup_descriptions.README_commands:
# Guide to Build and Run Docker for unslothai/unsloth

1. **Install Docker**: Ensure Docker is installed on your machine. Follow the installation guide for your operating system from the [Docker website](https://docs.docker.com/get-docker/).

2. **Install NVIDIA Container Toolkit** (if using GPUs): Follow the instructions on the [NVIDIA website](https://docs.nvidia.com/datacenter/cloud-native/container-toolkit/install-guide.html) to set up the NVIDIA Container Toolkit.

3. **Clone the Repository**: Open your terminal and clone the repository:
   ```bash
   git clone https://github.com/unslothai/unsloth.git
   cd unsloth
   ```

4. **Create a Work Directory**: Ensure you have a `work` directory in the current path:
   ```bash
   mkdir work
   ```

5. **Run the Docker Container**: Execute the following command to start the Docker container:
   ```bash
   docker run -d -e JUPYTER_PASSWORD="mypassword" \
     -p 8888:8888 -p 2222:22 \
     -v $(pwd)/work:/workspace/work \
     --gpus all \
     unsloth/unsloth
   ```

6. **Access Jupyter Notebook**: Open your web browser and navigate to `http://localhost:8888`. Enter the password `mypassword` when prompted.

7. **SSH Access (Optional)**: If you need SSH access, connect using:
   ```bash
   ssh -p 2222 user@localhost
   ```

Replace `user` with the appropriate username for the container.

8. **Stop the Container**: To stop the running container, find its ID with:
   ```bash
   docker ps
   ```
   Then stop it using:
   ```bash
   docker stop <container_id>
   ```

9. **Remove the Container** (Optional): If you want to remove the container after stopping it:
   ```bash
   docker rm <container_id>
   ```

You are now set up to use the unslothai/unsloth Docker container!
